content: k2 p3* eleven times 3 *p1 p2tog k2 p2tog p1* eleven times = 66 st 4 *p2 k2 p2* eleven times 5 *p2tog k2 p2tog* eleven times = 44 st 6 *p1 k2 p1* eleven times 7 move marker back 1 st and then *p2tog k2* eleven times = 33 st 8 *p1 k2* eleven times 9 *p1 ssk* eleven times = 22 st 10 *p1 k1* eleven times 11 move marker back 1 st and then ssk eleven times = 11 st finishing cut yarn leaving about a 12 tail thread tail through the remaining 11 stitches on needles one or two times slip off needles and pull snug slip tail through center hole this will be used later to attach pompom if desired weave in any other loose threads block using your preferred method i typically soak my hats for 15 minutes in warm water and spin it on gentle in my washing machine to get the excess water out i then stretch the hat over a suitably sized mixing bowl being sure that the ribbing curls underneath the bowl and is not stretched i let the hat get about 80% dry and then take it off the bowl and lie it flat on a towel to dry fully if you want to add a pompon you may make your own extra yarn will be required or purchase one attach at top center using method of your choice this should be your last step and done after blocking i also added a couple of bee charms which are optional note this hat pattern was inspired by a cowl pattern free by claire borchardt which is shown in the photo at the top of page 1 the pattern for this cowl may be found on ravelry at https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/apiarist-cowl abbreviations co - cast on pm - place marker k - knit stitch p - purl stitch kf/b in a single st k one st in the front and a second st in the back results in an increase of 1 st dpn double pointed needles 1/1 lc - slip next st onto cable needle and hold to front of work purl next st from left hand needle then knit st from cable needle 1/1 rc - slip next st onto cable needle and hold to back of work k next stitch from left hand needle then purl st from cable needle 1/2 lc - slip next st onto cable needle and hold to front of work purl next 2 stitches from left hand needle then knit stitch from cable needle 1/2 rc - slip next 2 stitches onto cable needle and hold to back of work knit next stitch from left hand needle then purl 2 stitches from cable needle all efforts were made to make this pattern error-free 2025kristina k miller intended for individual home use only not to be reproduced or reknit for profit all efforts were made to make this pattern error-free 2025kristina k
